required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Explorative RVA of the Motor Development of Children With DCD <2y
clinical_study.official_title: An Explorative Retrospective Video-analysis of the Motor Development of Children With Developmental Coordination Disorder Before the Age of Two

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares motor development in three groups of infants (controls, DCD, DCD+ASD) before the age of 2 years using retrospective video analysis of infants in home video contexts.

primary_outcome.description: We will observe the motor development of infants in different positions (Prone, supine, sitting and standing position ect.) and during different motor activities (rolling over, crawling, standing up, walking independently ect).

arm_group.description: This groups consists of children now aged 6-12y: Without a medical diagnosis possibly influencing motor development Without motor problems (M-ABC-2 and DCD-Q) Without social reponsiveness problems (SRS-2)
This groups consists of children now aged 6-12y: With a multidisciplinary diagnosis of DCD With motor problems (M-ABC-2 and DCD-Q) Without social responsiveness problems (SRS-2)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Developmental Coordination Disorder + Autism Spectrum Disorder
arm_group.description: This groups consists of children now aged 6-12y: With a multidisciplinary diagnosis of DCD With motor problems (M-ABC-2 and DCD-Q) With social responsiveness problems (SRS-2)

intervention.description: The M-ABC-2 is a motor performance test for children aged 3 trough 16 years of age. We will use Dutch-Flemish norms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Developmental Coordination Disorder + Autism Spectrum Disorder

intervention.description: The DCD-Q is a brief parent questionnaire designed to screen for the presence of DCD in children aged 5 trough 15 years of age. We will use Dutch norms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Developmental Coordination Disorder + Autism Spectrum Disorder

intervention.description: The SRS-2 is a parent questionnaire designed to identify social impairments associated with ASD in children 4 trough 18 years of age. We will used Dutch norms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Developmental Coordination Disorder + Autism Spectrum Disorder

intervention.description: Retrospective video analysis will be used to explore motor development in children with DCD, DCD+ASD and controls.
intervention.arm_group_label: Developmental Coordination Disorder + Autism Spectrum Disorder

criteria.textblock:
CONTROLS:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Availability of video material of the child before the age of 2.
- No indication of DCD (as measured by M-ABC-2 Pc>16 and DCD-Q)
- No indication of ASD (as measured by SRS-2 T-score ≤60 )
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical diagnosis possibly influencing motor development (DCD, ASD, ADHD, CP, ect)
- Severe ilnesses in the early Developmental period (0-2y) which may have influenced the development (f.e. CVA, cancer, severe traumas,...)
- Prolonged admission to the hospital (≥ 3 weeks) in the early Developmental period (0-2y)
DCD GROUP:
Inclusion criteria:
- Availability of video material of the child before the age of 2.
- Formal diagnosis of DCD provided by multidisciplinary team in Flanders
- Indication of DCD (as measured by M-ABC-2 Pc≤16 and DCD-Q)
- No indication of ASD (as measured by SRS-2 T-score ≤60)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other medical diagnosis possibly influencing motor development (ASD, ADHD, CP, ect)
- Severe ilnesses in the early Developmental period (0-2y) which may have influenced the development (f.e. CVA, cancer, severe traumas,...)
- Prolonged admission to the hospital (≥ 3 weeks) in the early Developmental period (0-2y)
DCD+ASD GROUP:
Inclusion criteria:
- Availability of video material of the child before the age of 2.
- Formal diagnosis of DCD and ASD provided by multidisciplinary team in Flanders
- Indication of DCD (as measured by M-ABC-2 Pc≤16 and DCD-Q)
- Indication of ASD (as measured by SRS-2 T-score >60 )
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other medical diagnosis possibly influencing motor development (ADHD, CP, ect.)
- Severe ilnesses in the early Developmental period (0-2y) which may have influenced the development (f.e. CVA, cancer, severe traumas,...)
- Prolonged admission to the hospital (≥ 3 weeks) in the early Developmental period (0-2y)
